layout_composition.explanation: Structure is disciplined: each section opens with a big left-aligned title, a thin horizontal rule, and a compact meta row followed by a tightly executed thumbnail grid. Grids maintain uniform tile sizes and even gutters across multiple long sections; captions/meta positions repeat exactly, yielding strong rhythm. The centered sticky-note hero uses ample white space and a soft shadow to establish a focal point without clutter. Minor roughness: the circular M/L control floats left of some sections and doesn’t align to the main column, and the wrapped heading in the 'Webflow Dot Com' section breaks the otherwise steady rhythm.

color.explanation: A restrained black-on-white shell keeps focus on colorful project tiles; thin grey dividers and the warm orange sticky-note hero provide limited but coherent accents. Imagery is varied and saturated, yet the neutral frame prevents clashes. Limitations: neutrals read close to pure black/white rather than tuned off-neutrals; no visible link/CTA state system; the highly varied tile artwork introduces some value flicker across rows.

typography.explanation: Readable, minimal type with adequate hierarchy but little evidence of refined micro‑craft. Observations: 1) Hero paragraph uses a serif with ~45–60ch measure and ~1.4–1.5 leading, left‑aligned and easy to scan. 2) Project titles use a repeated prefix dot and a small meta line beneath, giving a basic two‑level system. 3) Navigation labels in the top right are light‑weight sans and unobtrusive. Limitations: manual line breaks in the hero create an uneven rag, link styling/state is not evident (looks like basic black text), and title/meta sizes sit close together with reliance on weight instead of a clear modular scale.

layout_composition.explanation: Composition is competent with a consistent two‑column grid and clear gutters. Observations: 1) Alternating two‑up project tiles with captions underneath align cleanly across the row. 2) A full‑width feature tile breaks the grid intentionally and remains centered, adding variety. 3) Device mock tiles maintain similar offsets to captions, and spacing between sections is generous. Limitations: a heavy black band near the footer overlaps/cuts into the preceding visual tiles, breaking vertical rhythm, and the varying tile heights and mixed presentation styles (full‑bleed logo block vs device mock on a mat) introduce mild visual wobble.

color.explanation: Color feels jumpy rather than unified. Observations: 1) Chrome relies on stark black on white and a very dark (#000‑like) footer bar—an abrupt value jump. 2) Project tiles use saturated, unrelated backgrounds (bright orange, blue gradient, lavender block, deep navy) that do not share a unifying mat or border tint, causing flicker across the grid. 3) No visible accent/link color system; text links look like default black. Limitation: without tuned neutrals or a restrained accent strategy, the brand‑heavy tiles dominate and the shell does little to harmonize them.

typography.explanation: Readable sans system with clear hierarchy: large H1, smaller centered intro paragraph, and card titles with brief meta. Paragraph measure is comfortable and leading looks balanced. However, links use what appears to be default blue with a standard underline and no visible hover/state tuning. Casing and weight are mostly consistent, but the centered hero paragraph produces a slightly uneven rag and feels generic. Button labels and nav use similar sizes but lack a distinctive typographic voice.

layout_composition.explanation: Two‑column card grid shows consistent gutters and matching rounded cards with soft shadows; captions align neatly under thumbnails. Section breaks are clear (hero → grid → CTA), and spacing feels on a repeatable system. Roughness: variable card heights create an irregular vertical rhythm; one tile uses an angled phone mock while others are flat screenshots, breaking cohesion; hero is centered while the work grid is left‑weighted without an explicit grid rationale. Template cues are strong: centered 'Hello! I'm …' hero, uniform white cards with shadows, and a stock 'Like what you see?' CTA block.

color.explanation: Shell is mostly black on white, but project tiles introduce many unrelated pastel backplates (yellow, orange, purple, green, pink, teal) that cause grid flicker rather than unifying the imagery. Links appear in default bright blue, while buttons are near‑black—no clear, consistent accent strategy. Shadows and greys are neutral but there’s little hue tuning to harmonize the diverse screenshots.

typography.explanation: Readable, minimal sans system with clear hierarchy. Observations: 1) Large bold H1 'Hey, I’m Robin' contrasted with a smaller right‑column intro; 2) Body copy block shows comfortable measure (~55–65ch) and stable leading around 1.4–1.6; 3) Consistent sentence case and weight steps between H2 'Nice to meet you' and paragraph text. Limitations: link styling on 'resume' appears conservative/default with a basic underline and no evident hover/state tuning; overall voice feels generic with no bespoke link underline thickness or typographic micro‑craft visible.

layout_composition.explanation: Clean two‑column structure repeated across hero and the 'Nice to meet you' section. Observations: 1) Consistent left alignment and generous margins create a calm rhythm; 2) Clear vertical spacing and a subtle divider separate sections; 3) Photo sits in the right column with balanced breathing room and aligns well with the text block. Limitations: overall composition is conventional and template‑like (simple hero + 2‑column about) with limited evidence of advanced grid work, complex galleries, or refined card systems.

color.explanation: Neutrals are pleasant and controlled. Observations: 1) Off‑white/soft grey background and off‑black text avoid harsh #000/#fff; 2) A slightly darker band in the footer provides value separation without noise; 3) Color is primarily carried by the single photo, preventing clashes. Limitations: No clear accent/color system for interactive elements (link color and states not clearly integrated), and minimal unifying tactics since there’s only one asset; palette feels safe rather than intentional.

typography.explanation: Clear, restrained hierarchy across three columns: section headers ('Projects', 'Thoughts & ideas') use a heavier weight while item titles are bold with lighter meta/dates beneath. Comfortable measures (~55–70ch) and steady leading (~1.4–1.6) keep dense lists readable. Links are customized (no default blue; arrow '→' cues) and repeat consistently in "See all/Browse all" lines. Rags are mostly clean with consistent sentence‑case descriptions. Limitation: list columns get a bit dense, and a few lines end with short single‑word tails that slightly disturb the rag.

layout_composition.explanation: Disciplined three‑column grid with consistent gutters; the hero line aligns cleanly to the left column. Repetition is handled well: uniform list item spacing, consistent title→description→meta rhythm, and right‑rail cards share identical paddings and arrow placement. The vertical nav on the right is visually tidy with a clear active indicator. Limitation: the right nav/rail feels slightly detached from the main grid, and overall vertical rhythm is tight which can read a bit crowded.

color.explanation: Tuned neutrals: off‑black text on soft white, light‑grey cards, and subtle grey meta text. A single accent (orange dot/arrows) provides hierarchy without noise and is applied consistently. The dark side gutters frame the content and keep the palette restrained. Limitation: the side gutters are relatively heavy compared with the light interior and could create edge weight; CTA cards in flat grey feel slightly muted and could use a touch more depth or tint control.

typography.explanation: Readable, coherent system with clear scale steps. Evidence: 1) Large display headline with tighter leading, project titles set in a consistent weight/size; 2) Meta labels and pill tags use a uniform micro‑style (small caps/uppercase, even letter‑spacing) and repeat identically under each card; 3) Body copy blocks under cards sit at a comfortable measure (~55–70ch) with consistent paragraph spacing. Limitations pulling to 3: the hero headline uses a blurred/ghosted effect that reduces clarity; link treatment/states are not visible (titles read as links but have no underline or alternative styling); title casing is inconsistent across cards (e.g., “Account settings” vs “ChromeOS PWA”), hinting at uneven typographic rules.

layout_composition.explanation: Strong grid and rhythm across the page. Evidence: 1) Two‑column hero with the right profile card aligned to the same container width and baseline as the left headline block; 2) Three‑column project grid keeps identical gutters and tile radii, with captions/badges positioned at consistent offsets; 3) Card interiors use stable mats that contain varied screenshots/illustrations without edge hugging, producing a steady scan pattern. Minor roughness: image heights vary slightly by card, creating subtle vertical rhythm wobble, and a few screenshots are small/unreadable at this zoom.

color.explanation: Considered neutrals with a disciplined, card‑based accent strategy. Evidence: 1) Off‑white background and soft off‑black text avoid harsh #000/#fff; 2) Each card uses a single, desaturated mat color that unifies diverse imagery and keeps the chrome quiet; 3) Accents (pill badges, nav 'Work' chip) are controlled greys and subtle hues, maintaining hierarchy. Limitation: a couple of saturated mats (mustard, deep green) sit adjacent and feel slightly heavier than neighboring tiles, introducing minor value imbalance.

typography.explanation: All‑caps nameplate with loose tracking establishes a basic headline; small right‑aligned nav (Portfolio, About) uses the same sans for a simple hierarchy. Body copy is essentially absent; links show no customized styling or visible states. Casing is consistent but generic, and the overall voice feels default. Limitation: very little text prevents assessment of rhythm, measure, or link states; likely a standard system sans.

layout_composition.explanation: Two‑column collage presents uneven rhythm: mixed aspect ratios (wide presentation slide, tall dual phone screenshots, full‑bleed iMac logo, landscape photo) create irregular vertical bottoms. Assets mix device frames and perspectives (iMac, laptop + phone, angled tablet/phone set, straight phones) with inconsistent mats and shadow logic. Several thumbnails appear too small to read (chat list, orange app flows). The grid lacks consistent captioning and alignment anchors, leading to visual wobble. Limitation: only one breakpoint is visible.

color.explanation: Shell is pure white with black text; no tuned neutrals or accent system visible. Imagery introduces disparate hues (hot orange UI, cobalt blues, grayscale photography) without unifying mats or border tints, causing flicker between tiles. Mixed white balances and saturation across photos and device mocks further disrupt cohesion. Limitation: hover/active states not visible.

typography.explanation: Readable, conservative sans system. Header micro‑labels (“PRODUCT DESIGNER” / location) use consistent all‑caps with even letter‑spacing; nav (“WORK / ABOUT / RESUME”) repeats the same style. Project titles and grey descriptions form a clear two‑step hierarchy under each tile and alignment is consistent. However, link styling and states are not evident, the voice is generic, and there’s little evidence of tuned rhythm or bespoke details (no customized underline/hover, no visible scale system beyond two sizes).

layout_composition.explanation: Clean single container with wide margins; the header’s left/center/right triad aligns neatly. A two‑column grid holds uniformly sized thumbnails with consistent gutters and caption offsets. Tiles share square corners and no heavy shadows, keeping structure tidy. Limitations: the final row contains a single left‑aligned tile creating an empty right column; imagery lacks mats/borders so busy photo edges meet the page chrome; overall layout reads as boilerplate without a distinctive POV.

color.explanation: Neutral shell (white background, black headers, mid‑grey captions) provides adequate contrast. Color is carried by photographs, but varied white balances—warm wood tabletop, cool office scene, brown forest floor—introduce palette flicker. No clear accent color or unifying mat/border tint to harmonize diverse imagery; footer social icons in solid black circles add another note without hierarchy.

typography.explanation: Clear hierarchy and a considered voice. Evidence: 1) Hero uses an accent italic on the name with a warm coral hue to signal primary heading; paragraph below sits at a comfortable measure (~65–75ch) with relaxed leading. 2) Repeated meta style under project tiles—small size with dot separators and light weight—shows a consistent labeling system. 3) Links in the hero appear customized (accent hue with a fine underline/offset) rather than default blue. 4) Section headers such as “Designing for Impact” reuse the accent color to reinforce structure. Limitation: link states aren’t visible and the bold stack in the dark ‘About’ block feels slightly heavy, and the hero paragraph runs a touch long, softening rhythm.

layout_composition.explanation: Competent grid with moments of uneven rhythm. Evidence: 1) Project tiles keep captions in the same position and use consistent gutters, suggesting a stable column system. 2) The “Designing for Impact” mosaic adheres to a three‑column grid with steady spacing and repeated caption offsets. 3) Sections are clearly separated with generous vertical space and a distinct dark band for the About area. Limitations: the black video tile introduces a sharp value jump and breaks row rhythm; the lime tile with a small centered phone leaves excessive negative space; the side‑by‑side duplicated About cards read redundant and a bit off‑grid, creating visual wobble.

color.explanation: Pleasant warm neutrals with a coherent coral accent, but supporting mats introduce flicker. Evidence: 1) Off‑white background and charcoal text indicate tuned neutrals with good readability. 2) Coral/orange accent is used consistently for the name, selected headings, links, and the sunburst mark. 3) Soft blue and pale lime mats add variety without overwhelming the shell. Limitations: the very dark/black project tile and saturated denim‑blue textures cause abrupt value and hue jumps across rows; the assortment of mat colors feels opportunistic rather than role‑driven, reducing cohesion.

typography.explanation: Readable sans system with clear scale between hero, section headers, and body. Hero lines sit in a comfortable 3–4 line block; body copy under the hero has a roughly 60–70ch measure and 1.4–1.6 leading; testimonial cards use a consistent small label/meta style. Custom yellow marker highlights add some typographic voice. Limitations: emphasis relies on word‑level bolds within the hero creating patchy rhythm; mixed casing conventions (e.g., 'I worked on…' vs 'What it’s like working with me'); links/CTA states aren’t evident and link styling looks close to defaults. Template scent modules ("Hi, I’m [Name]" hero, testimonial block, logo strip) keep the system feeling generic.

layout_composition.explanation: Overall one‑column structure with consistent container width and generous vertical spacing. Project tiles are unified by rounded cards, captions, and a repeated 'Read more' CTA; testimonial grid keeps even gutters and matching card radii; footer and logo band align to the same column width. Limitations: device mockups dominate while content inside is small/unreadable; second project tile shows a heavy white gradient/partial fade that feels like a broken overlay; several devices are cropped at edges and tilted, reducing clarity. The page leans on standard modules (hero → projects → testimonials → logos → contact) without a strong compositional point of view.

color.explanation: Tuned neutrals and a coherent pale‑yellow section backdrop; consistent yellow accent via marker highlights and small scribble marks; off‑black body text avoids harsh #000/#fff contrast. Limitations: project card mats vary between cool gray and mint‑green causing slight rhythm flicker; the confetti background introduces multiple micro‑hues that add noise; logo strip mixes full‑color and monochrome marks, breaking the otherwise restrained palette. CTA/link color logic and hover/visited states are not clearly expressed.

typography.explanation: Readable, minimal system‑sans setup with a clear hierarchy. Evidence: 1) Centered hero paragraph sits at a comfortable measure (~55–65ch) with adequate leading; 2) Section title 'Featured work' uses a larger weight/size step that is consistent with the nav size; 3) Links appear in a bright, defaultish blue without visible custom underline or state tuning. Limitations: default link styling and lack of visible states feel generic; no clear evidence of a disciplined scale system beyond two steps.

layout_composition.explanation: Straightforward vertical stack with generous whitespace and consistent container width. Evidence: 1) Two large project tiles are centered and align to the same max width; 2) Spacing between hero, section header, and tiles reads even and intentional; 3) No obvious misalignments or cut‑off crops. Limitation: mixed presentation styles (layered screenshots vs device mock) and differing tile aspect ratios create rhythm flicker; absence of captions/mats reduces cohesion.

color.explanation: Neutral white shell supports content; accent appears as bright link blue. Evidence: 1) Text color reads as off‑black/grey, maintaining legibility; 2) Two project tiles carry most of the color without clashing; 3) Links are a saturated blue that stands out clearly. Limitation: the strong, differing background colors of the two tiles jump in value and there are no unifying mats/borders or tuned link hues, keeping the palette at a basic level.

typography.explanation: Clear, restrained sans system with strong hierarchy. 1) Large display headline with generous, even leading and a correct em dash treatment; 2) Section titles "Projects" and "About" share scale/weight and align to a consistent left edge; 3) Body, captions, and meta use smaller, lighter styles with predictable spacing and comfortable measures; 4) Captions repeat the same label/meta pattern and casing. Limitations: link styling (e.g., underlined "Allbirds" and press items) appears close to default with no visible state tuning, and the pure black/white pair makes the type feel slightly stark.

layout_composition.explanation: Confident, simple grid with disciplined rhythm. 1) Edge-to-edge hero image anchored to a consistent content width; 2) Project grid keeps equal column widths and uniform image heights with identical caption offsets; 3) Clear section separation and hierarchy (large "Projects" header, then tiles); 4) The black "About" band organizes content into three columns (photo, services/locations, clients/press) aligned to the same vertical grid. Limitation: the small "Contact" button in the dark footer band reads a bit floaty and visually detached from the columns.

color.explanation: Minimal palette that lets photography carry color. 1) Neutral white shell for hero/projects and a single inverted black section to create contrast; 2) Captions use subdued greys, not competing with imagery; 3) Colorful footwear photos feel balanced against the neutral chrome. Limitations: neutrals look like pure #000/#fff rather than tuned greys, and link/CTA state colors are not evident, keeping the system from feeling fully refined.

typography.explanation: Readable sans system with clear hierarchy: very large display 'Hi, I’m …' pairs with a 55–65ch paragraph set in comfortable leading; micro‑copy like 'Featured Projects' and project captions are legible. Name highlighted in red creates a focal point without collisions. However, link treatment appears defaultish (red with plain underline on repeated 'NDA Protected' text; underline weight/offset not tuned), neutrals read as pure #000 on #fff which feels harsh, and casing/scale mix is a bit uneven ('Featured Projects' small vs oversized left project list; 'Let’s Connect' title case with different rhythm). No visible state styling or refined underline behaviors.

layout_composition.explanation: Overall grid is understandable: left column list of projects with a right column preview, then a distinct canvas section and a contact block. Spacing breathes and elements don’t collide. Issues: the project preview starts mid‑way down the row leaving a large empty area above (asymmetric negative space without clear intent), the 'Creative Canvas' area has a huge dotted container with two small, rotated images that feel floaty and under‑anchored to the grid, and the 'Let’s Connect' block uses a large red rounded shape where heading, divider, and pill buttons don’t align cleanly to a shared grid (divider/eye icon sits oddly relative to the heading; buttons float on the right).

color.explanation: Consistent single accent strategy: a saturated red drives emphasis across hero wordmark, project list selection, the grid outline, and the contact section. Contrast is strong and buttons are readable. Limitations: neutrals appear as pure black/white rather than tuned greys, producing a slightly harsh shell; confetti/red speckle background adds noise; additional hues from imagery (purple and cyan cards) aren’t harmonized via mats or tints, so the page relies on the loud red rather than a unified palette.

typography.explanation: Distinctive serif display for section titles creates a clear voice; headings like “Discord Mobile Redesign” and “Blitz” repeat the same size/weight treatment. Body and meta copy sit at comfortable measures with even leading and readable contrast on the warm off‑white background. Repeated right‑column meta (dates/role) is scaled down consistently and aligns to the text baseline, reinforcing a disciplined hierarchy. No default blue links visible; link/CTA treatments appear custom and understated. Limitation: some micro‑labels are very light/low‑contrast and link states aren’t evident from this view.

layout_composition.explanation: Consistent grid and rhythm across multiple sections: each project block uses the same pattern (title + short intro + right‑side meta + a wide, edge‑aligned image). Generous, even vertical spacing between sections; small grid‑stamp ornaments act as subtle section markers without crowding. Image tiles are clean rectangles with matching edges and no mismatched radii or device frames; alignment to the main column is precise. Limitation: the Airbase collage introduces angled cards that slightly disturb the otherwise strict rhythm, and the decorative hero has a large circular motif that feels a bit floaty compared to the tighter grid below.

color.explanation: Warm off‑white canvas with off‑black text shows tuned neutrals; colorful project imagery sits comfortably without clashing. Accents are sparse and controlled—ornamental grid marks and subtle gradients add interest while keeping emphasis on the work. The dark footer establishes a clear tonal zone with a consistent navy/teal system and icon grid. Limitation: the jump from the light body to a very dark footer is abrupt, and a few project thumbnails use hotter purple/pink gradients that momentarily spike saturation relative to the otherwise muted shell.

typography.explanation: Large all‑caps hero with generous tracking reads clean; small uppercase subtitle with spaced dots is consistent; project captions repeat a clear pattern (client label on the left, sentence‑case description with a pipe and year). Body/caption measures are comfortable and nav labels are tidy. Limitations: footer links look defaultish (black underlines with no visible state), overall face choice is a generic sans with little tuning, and the mismatch between left‑aligned client labels and centered description lines weakens hierarchy/alignment.

layout_composition.explanation: Clear single-column structure with strong focal hero; patterned strip creates an intentional section break. Three project tiles share the same container width with even vertical spacing and ample whitespace. Collage-style tiles are framed cleanly and captions sit in predictable positions beneath each tile. Limitations: varying tile heights create slight vertical rhythm flicker; client labels left and descriptions centered introduce alignment tension; the bottom 'Made in Framer' badge pulls a bit of stray attention.

color.explanation: Distinct, cohesive palette: deep burgundy hero paired with olive/cream patterned strip; project tiles use complementary warm textures (beige/green/red) that harmonize with the hero and help unify mixed screenshots. Accents are restrained and the textured mats prevent UI blues from clashing. Limitations: neutrals lean toward pure black on white (less tuned greys), footer/link color does not establish a clear state system, and the patterned strip is slightly saturated relative to the otherwise calm shell.

typography.explanation: Decorative script is used for the hero line and section headings while body copy is a plain sans; the pairing feels mismatched and reduces clarity rather than adding hierarchy. Project captions are small white text placed directly on photos, yielding low contrast and difficult readability in several tiles. Link/label system is unclear—nav items look like plain text with only one underlined state and no visible hover/visited logic. Rags and line lengths are acceptable, but the typographic voice reads junior and inconsistent with the content. Limitation: static capture prevents verifying interactive link states.

layout_composition.explanation: The page relies on generic modules: centered hero, a 3‑card work row, a testimonial carousel, and a contact block, giving a strong template scent. Section headings sit outside large rounded cards and don’t align cleanly with the grids below, creating off‑grid starts/finishes. The three work tiles mix orientations and add an isolated right‑tile arrow overlay—interaction affordances are inconsistent. The ‘My Process’ section shows two tiny diagram cards that read floaty with oversized inner margins and unreadable content. The testimonial card has heavy chrome (rounded rectangle with border and shadow) and uneven internal spacing between the left meta column and right text. Limitation: only one breakpoint is visible.

color.explanation: A warm beige gradient shell is cohesive and uses softened neutrals rather than pure #000/#fff. However, imagery is not harmonized: warm wood desk, cool grey phone, and bright white desktop create temperature flicker without mats or tints to unify. White caption text on photos reduces contrast. The two process diagrams introduce many saturated hues that clash with the muted shell. Despite these issues, overall contrast in body copy areas is acceptable. Limitation: cannot assess hover/active color states from the screenshot.

typography.explanation: Readable sans with clear hierarchy (large H1, smaller subhead, section heads like 'Selected Work' and 'About'). Paragraphs sit in a comfortable measure (~55–70ch) with generous leading. Repeated chip/CTA style uses consistent casing/weight. However, link/CTA styling shows little micro‑tuning (plain black pill without visible hover/underline system), punctuation/casing varies ('Also a traveler!' vs title case elsewhere), and there’s no evidence of refined rhythm (widow control, underline weight/offset, or optical alignment). Overall competent but generic.

layout_composition.explanation: Structure is clear: left‑aligned hero, a single‑column stack of uniformly sized work cards, and a balanced two‑column About section. Spacing feels consistent with wide gutters and even section breaks; card radii and chip placement repeat. Weaknesses: the work tiles place small screenshots inside large blurred photo backgrounds, making core UI unreadable; CTA pills float at top‑right of cards with slight vertical variance; a large 'Coming Soon' gray placeholder breaks grid rhythm and polish. Image handling reduces clarity even though the grid itself is orderly.

color.explanation: Monochrome shell (off/near‑black on white) with black pills provides safe, consistent contrast. B&W travel thumbnails help keep noise down. Still, the blurred photo backgrounds behind case tiles introduce inconsistent tints/values, and a brightly colored toy‑block photo pops without a unifying mat or border treatment. No evident link/hover state colors or tuned neutral system to elevate beyond basics.

typography.explanation: Readable serif with disciplined hierarchy: company names set heavier than roles; dates consistently styled in italics aligned to a secondary column; en‑dashes used for date ranges. Paragraph leading appears generous and consistent, and link styling is customized (muted orange email link, no default blue). However, the intro paragraph runs quite wide (roughly 90–100ch), which hurts reading rhythm; nav labels are small/light risking low contrast; minimal evidence of hover/state systems.

layout_composition.explanation: Clear two‑column structure for entries (company/role left, dates right) with descriptions spanning below creates a coherent scan path. Vertical rhythm feels consistent across multiple sections; spacing between entries and the offset before/after the pill 'View work' buttons repeats precisely. The page maintains strong alignment and balance with restrained elements and ample whitespace. Limitation: the very long intro text block at the top breaks the otherwise tidy rhythm and could use a narrower measure; the script mark in the top-left feels loosely tied to the underlying grid.

color.explanation: Neutral palette with likely off‑white background, dark grey text, and soft grey outlines on buttons; a single accent (warm orange) used sparingly for the email link keeps the page calm. Footer social icons are subdued and consistent. Limitations: accent usage is isolated (not evident on nav or buttons), and state colors are not demonstrated, so the color system feels serviceable rather than refined.

typography.explanation: Clean single sans system with a large, bold display hero and comfortable leading; the intro paragraph reads ~60–70ch with light grey tone; project titles repeat a consistent size/weight and small meta labels appear above (e.g., company tag with chevron). Rags are tidy and casing is consistent across headings and captions. Limitations: link treatment is ambiguous (titles and 'See all work' read like plain text with no visible underline/state), the hero relies on a very common pattern and an inline emoji slightly lowers polish, and there’s little evidence of customized micro‑craft such as tuned underline offsets or advanced scale ratios.

layout_composition.explanation: Strong single‑column rhythm with consistent container width from hero through the work list; clear section break labeled 'Selected work' with a right‑aligned 'See all work' creating a reliable grid edge; each project tile uses full‑width image mats with matching radii and generous, even paddings; captions align left with repeatable offsets and spacing. Image handling is disciplined—3D device renders are crisp, centered, and not cut off; tile backgrounds harmonize and keep rhythm stable down the page. Limitation: structure is conventional and leans on a repeated hero‑tile pattern with minimal variation, and the 'See all work' label feels slightly floaty on the far right without a visible rule or column guide.

color.explanation: Tuned neutrals (off‑white background, near‑navy text) create calm contrast; soft blue image mats unify diverse UI renders; muted grey for meta text supports hierarchy. Accent strategy is restrained—blue appears in labels/titles while a single orange pill in the nav provides a secondary accent, and shadows under renders are subtle and hue‑consistent. Limitation: multiple small accents (orange CTA, blue accents, and a green emoji) introduce a touch of aesthetic drift without a clearly defined state system.

typography.explanation: Readable, conservative system sans with clear hierarchy. Hero paragraph has a comfortable ~55–65ch measure and 1.4–1.6 leading; headings, captions (project title + muted company line) repeat consistently; button label uses a light outline that matches body weight reasonably. However, the voice feels generic (default‑ish sans, outline CTA, and plain 'See projects' text); link styling/states are not evident; casing mixes Title Case in tiles with sentence‑case 'See projects'; and the hero copy rag ends abruptly, suggesting minimal rhythm tuning.

layout_composition.explanation: Structure is conventional: left‑text/right‑graphic hero, then a 2‑column project grid with even horizontal gutters. But multiple image‑handling issues reduce polish: (1) inconsistent tile aspect ratios create ragged row bottoms; (2) mixed presentation styles—raw dark UI screenshots, a grey device mock with multiple devices, a white collage board—produce rhythm flicker; (3) several screenshots are zoomed out and unreadable inside frames; (4) internal mats/shadows vary by tile. The 'See projects' down arrow and uniform two‑column case rows further read as template modules.

color.explanation: The deep green hero is a pleasant, tuned neutral and contrasts cleanly with white type. Below, color control weakens: tiles swing from very dark UIs to bright white boards and a mid‑grey device mock, with no unifying mat or border system, causing value flicker row to row. Accent strategy is unclear beyond neutrals; the outline button and link text don’t establish a consistent accent hue; shadows/borders don’t appear to carry a cohesive tint that ties diverse imagery together.
